author: Special Correspondent
text:
In Pudukottai and Aranthangi

The Tamil Nadu Generation and Distribution Corporation has taken up a special programme for augmenting the efficiency in power transmission and ensuring quality power for consumers in the municipal towns of Pudukottai and Aranthangi.

A sum of Rs.26.38 crore has been allotted under the Restructured – Accelerated Power Development and Reforms Programme (R-APDRP) to achieve the goals.

Funded by the Power Finance Corporation, the programme is being implemented in two phases and the first phase had been completed at an estimate of Rs. 3.33crore.

The second phase of the programme has been taken up in these two municipal towns at an estimate of Rs. 23.05 crore. It aims at replacing the old electro-mechanical meters, numbering 61,161.

Instead, static meters will be fitted in domestic and commercial establishments. “The old meters have been the main source of power loss and fall in quality of power,” said an official of the TANGEDCO. Special focus was on setting up transformers and as many as 304 transformers would be set up for power transmission.

New low tension and high tension distribution lines would be set up. The cumulative length would be 42.71 km for low tension, 59.05 km for high tension lines.

The programme is being implemented in two phases. In the first phase, Rs.3.33 crore had been spent.

“In the first phase, a study on the power transmission loss, energy audit and other data were compiled,” the official said.
title: Programme to supply quality power
